title: unesco_heritage_La_Fortaleza_and_San_Juan_National_Historic_Site_in_Puerto_Rico
text:
Name: La Fortaleza and San Juan National Historic Site in Puerto Rico. short_description:

Between the 16th and 20th centuries, a series of defensive structures was built at this strategic point in the Caribbean Sea to protect the city and the Bay of San Juan. They represent a fine display of European military architecture adapted to harbour sites on the American continent.

. date_inscribed: 1983. danger: 0. date_end: . longitude: -66.125. latitude: 18.46666667. area_hectares: 33.39. category_long: Cultural. category_short: C. Country name: United States of America. Region: Europe and North America. iso_code: us. transboundary: 0. rev_bis: .
